subject: p14295224
History: Patient with recurrent right upper lobe pneumonia, change in right upper lobe pneumonia.
Findings: The patient has prior history of gastric pull-through with radiation therapy for esophageal cancer. Right upper lobe consolidation in posterior segment has slightly improved. The lungs are hyperinflated. 6 mm right lower lobe nodule is unchanged since. Small right pleural effusion is stable since. There is no pneumothorax. Mediastinal and cardiac contours are normal.
Impression: Right upper lobe infiltrate has improved since. There is no new lung consolidation.
